A positive reaction to PPD injection indicates that the patient has been exposed to Mycobacterium tuberculosis and mounted a cell-mediated immune response to the antigens present in the PPD. This is a type IV (delayed) hypersensitivity reaction. Type I hypersensitivity reactions are mediated by IgE antibodies and can result in anaphylaxis. Type II hypersensitivity reactions involve antibodies that target specific tissues or cells. Type III hypersensitivity reactions involve immune complexes formed from antigen and antibody that can deposit in tissues and lead to inflammation.
